channel.title: High Disk Size issue with Redash Postgres
channel.description:
### Issue Summary Query Results table is not getting flushed in the given `REDASH_QUERY_RESULTS_CLEANUP_MAX_AGE` Currently our query_results table itself is storing around `157GB` of data and doesn't get purged in the given time interval of 7 days. Wanted to understand if anything has been changed with the max_age variable for redash version 9 and above. We have recently moved from redash version 8 to 9.
A summary of the issue and the browser/OS environment in which it occurs.
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: 9 * Browser/OS: Postgres * How did you install Redash: Open Sourced git repository

item.title: High Disk Size issue with Redash Postgres
item.dc:creator: bettertogether
item.description:
I have the same issue with V10 running on docker.
How do I check the items you asked for?

Read full topic
item.source: High Disk Size issue with Redash Postgres

item.title: High Disk Size issue with Redash Postgres
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Is the query results cleanup job running regularly? Do you have any workers monitoring the periodic queue? Are you certain the REDASH_QUERY_RESULTS_CLEANUP_ENABLED environment variable has not been set to false?

Read full topic
item.source: High Disk Size issue with Redash Postgres
